body: What version of GLFW are you using?

The version given by `glfwGetVersionString()` is:

    3.2.1 X11 GLX EGL clock_gettime /dev/js Xf86vm shared

[I referred him from Stack Overflow.](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42798513/having-issues-with-glfws-callback-glfwsetdropcallback-on-debian/42799574#42799574)

rename.from: The glfwSetDropCallback callback doesn't appear to work on Debian 9.0 (stretch).
rename.to: Drop event not delivered on Xfce

body: Bug is due to Thunar providing `text/uri-list` while GLFW assumed `UTF8_STRING` was supported. Fix incoming.
This and many other bugs relating to XDND should be fixed now with 6a65341e14bc7745c52fe86fe53be08dbd682dd9.

issue.title: Pupil Player executable arguments

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Hi, I was trying to run pupil player (0.13) by command line, as usual:

> pupil_player /some/old/pupil/recording/path/

No success. Player will open in the "drag drop" state. Am I missing something?

issue.title: Drag and Drop do not work from Thunar 1.6.3

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body: I guess I have found the issue on my system. Not related to Open Box. It is related to Thunar and its XFCE https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/968

body: @elmindreda , what is the version of Thunar supported by glfw?
@cpicanco Drag and drop should work with any file manager that implements the XDND protocol. Is it not working with a particular version of Thunar?

Thank you for the information. I must say that I am just a user concerning glfw stuff. So what I can tell you for sure is that the pupil player application that is based on glfw does not receive drops from Xfce Thunar 1.6.3 but will receive drops from GNOME nautilus 3.14.1. Is there anything I can do to fix this? (also the title bar is missing)
@cpicanco Are you using a copy of GLFW that includes the fix above?
The pupil application uses libglfw3-dev as a dependency.
The version of GLFW you got from your package system isn't new enough to contain this fix.
Even in Ubuntu Xenial? (Their bundle is built in Ubuntu Xenial)
